name: Pork Tenderloin and Broccoli Stir-Fry
description: Broccoli is a source of vitamins A, E, C and selenium – noted for its anti-cancer properties.
preparation: Slice pork in half lengthwise, then thinly slice each half into strips.
Heat oil in Wok. Add pork and stir-fry for 2–3 minutes, until golden. Remove and set on a plate.
Add broccoli, pepper and Asian Stir-Fry Seasoning to wok. Drizzle with a little water; cover and steam for 2 minutes, until tender-crisp. Meanwhile, stir beef broth with cornstarch.
Return pork to wok and pour beef broth mixture overtop. Simmer, uncovered, for 1 minute, until sauce is thick.
